reviews.text: Stayed here overnight for an early flight. We were a bit worried about traffic noise when we arrived but didn't hear much in the room at all. Yes you will hear planes - you are next to a large airport!.
reviews.title: fine for an overnight stay

reviews.text: Room was clean and quite spacious and nice pool for a quick dip to end the day.
reviews.title: No sleep guranteed!

reviews.text: Very handy having the Denny's on the premises as not much to wander around to. Free shuttle prompt and worked well.
reviews.title: Money went missing after room cleaned, do not stay!!!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Would recommend this hotel for those looking for a night close to the airport.
reviews.title: Good value for the money

reviews.text: Stayed here one night before an early flight to LAX. If you are looking for a quiet night's sleep, this is not the place. The A/C didn't work, and throughout the night trucks, planes, suitcases, etc passed my room making the hard bed and pillows practically unbearable. I got up before my 4:30 am wake-up call! The room was clean (if a bit shabby), and the landscaping was quite nice. I had booked this hotel on the nice pictures and the price, but it was not worth losing a night of sleep!
reviews.title: best lax choice for us

reviews.text: We got a day room prior to flying out of LAX. Very good for the price $49. 95 (plus tax of course). Great value if you want a shower, quick meal at Dennys even a swim in the pool. Hotel shuttle leaves every half hour.
reviews.title: Great to use as day room

reviews.text: Great motel to use for our 1st night's stay in LA after a long flight from the UK.
reviews.title: Great motel to use after a long flight. Attached Denny's is a bonus

reviews.text: Ample parking, swift check in & a comfortable room.
reviews.title: Convenient

reviews.text: Hotel has a good size pool (although we didn't use it), & the Denny's restaurant on site made for a welcome evening meal & breakfast.
reviews.title: Great transit hotel near LAX

reviews.text: The hotel is only 5 minutes or so from all the major car rental depots, & even though it was close to LAX, plane noise was not too bad.
reviews.title: "It's like going back to 1960 again - in a good way"

reviews.text: I stayed in Travelodge, LAX for one night after taking a flight from Washington, D.C, on my way back to India.
reviews.title: Nice, simple and comfortable

reviews.text: The room was nice and spacious, but nowhere near luxurious. I guess luxury isnt even a criteria in this case. For a nice short business stay this wouldnt be a bad option, but I wouldnt come here on a holiday with my wife.
reviews.title: This was a great deal for the money and clean

reviews.text: They provided transportation to LAX which is real convinient.
reviews.title: Suited my needs

reviews.text: We stayed at this hotel only one night, because we needed to be close to our rental car pickup the following day. Fox Rental Car is right across the street. They have the best rates in LA for a car.
reviews.title: Good for overnight stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: It ended up being a very nice place. Very kitchie with catus outside of each room. It was a VERY busy hotel. it was clean, older, but well kept up. You will have to walk up stairs to the rooms. No elevators. We happened to placed in the far back area of the hotel. It took a bit to figure out where our room was and to haul our 4 pieces of luggage up the stairs.
reviews.title: Day rooms are a great value, and highly recommended for those long layovers...

reviews.text: Although probably the oldest motel for miles, and thus not in brand spanking new condition, we found that it was actually much less tired and shabby than other motels we stayed in on our trip (from a variety of chains). The room was larger and consequently more comfortable than others we'd experienced, as well as being in better condition. Being upstairs, we had a nice balcony - ground floor rooms each had a little terrace that would have been less private.
reviews.title: Better than the average chain motel, & brilliant for the airport

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed May 2011, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms surround a pool that is actually big enough to use (many motel pools are little bigger than bathtubs), and there is a gift shop selling drinks and confectionery - as well as tourist tat - until 10pm. A basic breakfast is included (6am to 9am only), but in a very confined area. However, a "Denny's" restaurant is also on site if you like expensive greasy stuff (and this one has a bar, which is good), and fast-food outlets are within walking distance.
reviews.title: we would certainly stay here again
Dated motel that's exactly right
reviews.text: The key to this place however is convenience; it's only about a mile and a half from LAX airport, and provides a shuttle bus; it's also very close to the rental car drop-off points, which also provide their own shuttles. This convenience comes at a price however (no, not a financial one - it's surprisingly cheap, especially if booked in advance) - the proximity to the airport means considerable 'plane noise, and century boulevard outside generates a lot of traffic noise.

However, it's location, location, location, and absolutely perfect for the airport in either direction. Also handy for other sout/west LA locations such as Long Beach, Redondo Beach, Venice Beach (mad and tacky, but good fune, and only about 5 miles), Santa Monica etc.
reviews.title: Very convenient location, excellent value!

reviews.text: We ( two couples) arrived at LAX quite early in the morning ( after a flight from Australia), and didn't have to wait too long for the shuttle to arrive (we called them to let them know we needed picking up).
reviews.title: That's someplace like home!
